Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scope

  • public class Scope
extends java.lang.Object
    Correspond to a Scope in code (Function, block, loop ...).
    A scope contains following informations :
    • An ancestor
    • An origin
    • A name
    • An offset, corresponding to current offset
    • An "innerScopeList", corresponding to a list of scope of anonymous block inside this scope
    • A table, containing every variables, parameters
    • A second table, containing scope of non-anonymous block
    Author:
    Frosqh

      • deplacement

        private int deplacement
        Scope's offset. Increments for each variable or parameter.
        See Also:
        getDeplacement()

      • innerScopeList

        private java.util.ArrayList<Scope> innerScopeList
        Scope's innerScopeList. Extends for each anonymous block encountered.

      • table

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> table
        Scope's table. Extends for each variable or parameter encountered.
        See Also:
        getTable()

      • secondTable

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Scope> secondTable
        Scope's second table. Extends for each non-anonymous block encountered.
        See Also:
        addScopeNotInner(String, Scope)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int tab)
        Print this Scope in format :
        Scope General
          functionName : [function, functionReturnType]
          Scope functionName:
          param1 : [param, param1type, offset]
          var1 : [var, var1type, offset, mutable?]
        Parameters:
        tab - Scope's offset (in tabulation)
        Returns:
        The string representing the Scope

      • getFromAncestor

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFromAncestor(java.lang.String name)
                                                       throws SemanticException
        Get the data in scope's ancestor.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the entry
        Returns:
        Data corresponding to name in scope's ancestor
        Throws:
        SemanticException - If trying to recover a non-existing data
        See Also:
        ancestor, isInAncestor(String)

      • isInAncestor

        private boolean isInAncestor(java.lang.String name)
        Check if data is in scope's ancestor.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the data to search
        Returns:
        'true' if the data is in scope's ancestor, 'false' otherwise
        See Also:
        ancestor, isInAncestor(String)
